text: The Hotplate was an Australian cooking reality television series which aired on the Nine Network on 28 July 2015. The show consisted of state-based restaurants with teams travelling the country to dine in and score each other's restaurants. The restaurants were judged by British food writer and critic, Tom Parker Bowles and Melbourne restaurateur, Scott Pickett.http://www.tvtonight.com.au/2015/03/nine-to-serve-up-the-hot- plate.html The show pit six established suburban restaurants against each other all striving for a leg up in the industry—and an extra $100,000 in the bank, Sydney's Guillaume Brahimi, the French-born chef, appeared as a special guest judge during all elimination episodes.http://mobile.news.com.au/entertainment/tv/nines-the-hot-plate- announces-guillaume-as-special-guest-judge/story-fn8yvfst-1227435919340 Only one season of the program has been produced, following legal action from the Seven Network claiming the format is too similar to its own program My Kitchen Rules. Nine and Seven reached a settlement in which Nine agreed that no further seasons would be produced, and the inaugural season would never be replayed. ==Format== Local restaurant heroes from around the country will do battle over dinner, they will be judged on all aspects of the restaurant experience. The worst performing teams will face elimination. The winner of the competition will receive $100,000 prize and realise their food dream.http://www.9jumpin.com.au/show/the- hotplate/2015/latest/episode-00/everything-you-need-to-know-about-the- hotplate/ == Series overview == {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align: center;" |- ! scope="col" rowspan="2" | Title ! scope="col" rowspan="2" | Episodes ! scope="col" colspan="2" | Originally aired ! scope="col" colspan="2" | Result |- ! scope="col" | Series premiere ! scope="col" | Series finale ! scope="col" | Winning couple ! scope="col" | Prize |- | | 18 | | | Marie & Emi | $100,000 |} {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:89%; text-align:center; width:85em" ! style="width:5%;" | Premiere date ! style="width:5%;" | Finale date ! style="width:10%;" | Winners ! style="width:10%;" | Runners-up ! style="width:40%;" colspan="2"| Other competing teams |- | rowspan="5"| 28 July 2015 | rowspan="5"| 2 September 2015 | rowspan="5"| Marie Yokoyama & | rowspan="5"| Aron & Vanessa |- ! 3rd | Lozz Klavins & |- ! 4th | Phillipe & Pascal Lebreux (NSW) |- ! 5th | Christina & Tania Harding (WA) |- ! 6th | Conrad Hector & Liam Jarman (WA) |} ==Elimination history== {|class="wikitable" style="width:100%; text- align:center; font-size: 85%; line-height:16px;" |+ Teams' Competition Progress | style="width:10%; text-align:right;"| Round: ! The teams and judges decide what they want to eat from their menu. Two entrees, mains and desserts are chosen. The teams score the team out of 10 for a whole score out of 50, the judges score the food and restaurant experience (separately out of 10) for a score out of 20 (score of 40 together). ====Christina & Tania - Italian==== * Episode 1 * Airdate — 28 July 2015 {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%; width:65em;" |+ Private Dinner Details and Scores ! colspan="5" | 1st Private Dinner |- ! style="width:15%;"| Meal ! colspan="4" style="width:40%;"| Christina & Tania - Italian |- | rowspan="2"| Entrées | colspan="4"| Funghi Alla Griglia (Grilled Mushrooms) |- | colspan="4"| Minestrone |- | rowspan="2"| Mains | colspan="4"| Bistecca Christina (Steak with Porcini Mushroom Sauce) |- | colspan="4"| Fettucine Con Pollo (Fettuccine with Chicken) |- | rowspan="2"| Desserts | colspan="4"| Sticky Date Pudding (With Butterscotch Sauce) |- | colspan="4"| Apple Crumble |- ! colspan="4" | Team Scores ! rowspan="2"| Whole Total |- ! Total |- | style="background:maroon; color:white;" | Marie & Emi | colspan="2"| 4 / 10 ! rowspan="5"| 25 / 50 ! rowspan="11"| 52 / 90 |- | style="background:skyblue; color:white;" | Phillipe & Pascal | colspan="2"| 5 / 10 |- | style="background:orange; color:white;" | Conrad & Liam | colspan="2"| 6 / 10 |- | style="background:orange; color:white;" | Christina & Tania | colspan="2"| 5 / 10 |- | style="background:skyblue; color:white;" | Aron & Vanessa | colspan="2"| 5 / 10 |- ! colspan="4" | Judges' Scores |- ! rowspan="2"| Judge ! colspan="2"| Score ! rowspan="2"| Total |- | Food | Experience |- | Tom | 6 / 10 | 8 / 10 ! rowspan="2"| 27 / 40 |- | Scott | 6 / 10 | 7 / 10 |- |} ===1st Elimination Dinner=== The 2 teams will cook 3 meals (like in the private dinners) over a 3-hour period, they must use 3 main ingredients but cooked to their style of cooking. The judges are joined by a special judge, Guillaume Brahimi, to judge the food. The over teams eat the food but do not judge it, the 2 teams are not given points but are only judge on how each meal tastes. * Episode 7 * Airdate — 10 August 2015 {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%; width:80em;" |+ Elimination Dinner Summary | style="background:orange; color:white;" | WA ! style="width:14%" scope="row"| Christina & Tania ! style="width:20%;" | Dishes ! style="width:20%;" | Result |- ! colspan="2"| Meal ! Their menus will have a makeover, they are given 3 new recipes which they have to put their food style into. They must deliver 3 dishes (same as the private dinners), each team are judged out of 100. ====Aron & Vanessa==== * Episode 8 * Airdate — 11 August 2015 {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%; width:65em;" |+ Makeover round summary ! colspan="4" | 1st Makeover Round |- ! style="width:15%;"| Meal ! colspan="3" style="width:40%;"| Aron & Vanessa |- | Entrée | colspan="3"| Chicken & Shitake Pie (with Tamarind Caramel) |- | Main | colspan="3"| Prosciutto Wrapped Eye Fillet (with Balmain Bug) |- | Dessert | colspan="3"| Deconstructed Lamington |- ! colspan="3" | Team Scores ! rowspan="2"| Whole Total |- ! Italian | rowspan="4" bgcolor="pink"| Eliminated |- | colspan="2"| Entrée | Barramundi (with Fennel purée) |- | colspan="2"| Main | Crumbed Pork Cutlet (with Peperonata) |- | colspan="2"| Dessert | Almond Panna Cotta (with Honey Almonds & Amaretto Cherries) |- style="border-top:3px solid #aaa;" | bgcolor="skyblue"| NSW ! scope="row"| Phillipe & Pascal ! style="width:20%;" | Dishes ! style="width:20%;" | Result |- ! colspan="2"| Meal ! French | rowspan="4" bgcolor="lightgreen"| Advanced |- | colspan="2"| Entrée | Salade Paysanne |- | colspan="2"| Main | Pork Fillet (with Mustard Sauce) |- | colspan="2"| Dessert | Apple & Frangipane Tart (with Crème Anglaise) |- style="border-top:3px solid #aaa;" |} ===Finals - Public Dinners=== Each team have to serve not only the other teams and judges' but also the general public, they will be judged be the general public. They will get help from their staff. Similar to the private dinners, each team will serve 2 different entrèes, mains & desserts. The eliminated teams will sit in with the public and score the overall experience. Two teams will be eliminated at the end of the round and the final two will go to the Grand Final. ====Marie & Emi==== * Episode 14 * Airdate — 25 August 2015 {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%; width:65em;" |+Public Dinner summary ! colspan="4" | 1st Public Dinner |- ! style="width:15%;"| Meal ! colspan="3" style="width:40%;"| Marie & Emi |- | rowspan="2"| Entrées | colspan="3"| Homemade Soba Noodles (with chicken broth) |- | colspan="3"| Tuna Tartare (with Avocado & Wasabi Puree and Jerusalem Artichoke) |- | rowspan="2"| Mains | colspan="3"| Miso Marinated Toothfish (with Black Garlic Sauce & Seaweed Salad) |- | colspan="3"| Slow Cooked Pork Belly (with Pumpkin Puree & Cabbage Slaw) |- | rowspan="2"| Desserts | colspan="3"| Black Sesame Panna Corta (with Shiso Granita) |- | colspan="3"| Japanese Whiskey SemiFreddo (with Nashi Pear Compote & Shaved Chestnuts) |- ! colspan="3" | Team Scores ! rowspan="2"| Whole Total |- ! rowspan=4| 6 | 16 | bgcolor="#CCCCFF" style="text-align:left"| | style="text- align:centre"| 31 August 2015 | Monday 7:30 pm | 0.850 | #11 | ! rowspan="4"| 0.829 |- | 17 | bgcolor="#CCCCFF" style="text-align:left"| | style="text- align:centre"| 1 September 2015 | Tuesday 7:30 pm | 0.833 | #8 | |- | rowspan="2"| 18 | bgcolor="#CCCCFF" style="text-align:left"| | rowspan="2" style="text-align:centre"| 2 September 2015 | rowspan="2"| Wednesday 7:30 pm | 0.783 | #9 | rowspan="2"| |- | bgcolor="#CCCCFF" style="text-align:left"| | 0.850 | #7 |- |} ==Stolen concept== On 2 August 2015, Network Seven launched a Federal Court case against Nine for plagiarism over their show My Kitchen Rules due to them "using almost identical casting, costuming, sets, music, promotion and judging processes to MKR...We believe Nine has appropriated Seven's My Kitchen Rules original format and related production elements, and contravened copyright. That's why we're in court" said a Network Seven spokesperson. The legal battle will ensue on Tuesday 4 August.http://www.smh.com.au/entertainment/tv-and-radio/seven-claims-nines- hotplate-infringes-its-copyright-20150802-gipow9.html#ixzz3hdQkPaot This follows after tension after Nine's Reno Rumble saw contestants from The Block competing against renovators from Seven's House Rules, however no legal proceedings followed because the contestants were no longer contracted to Seven.http://www.smh.com.au/entertainment/tv-and-radio/seven-claims-nines- hotplate-infringes-its-copyright-20150802-gipow9.html#ixzz3hdRA3M2Y On 6 August 2015, the courts ruled in Nine's favour and allowed the network to air the program, with Seven expected to appeal the verdict.http://www.tvtonight.com.au/2015/08/seven-loses-injunction-to-halt- hot-plate.html ===Cancellation=== On 19 February 2016, Seven and Nine both lodged a mutually-agreed settlement in the Federal Court, Nine agreed not to produce any further episodes and not to rebroadcast or distribute the first season across the Nine Network, both sides paid their own legal costs.http://www.tvtonight.com.au/2016/02/seven-nine-settle-hotplate- dispute.html ==See also== *My Kitchen Rules *My Restaurant Rules *MasterChef Australia *Restaurant Revolution == References == Category:Nine Network original programming Category:2015 Australian television series debuts Category:2015 Australian television series endings Category:Australian reality television series Category:Australian cooking television series Category:TV series involved in plagiarism controversies
title: The Hotplate
